marketNews.title: IHSG fell -0.86%
marketNews.content: IHSG fell -0.86%, Superbank owned by EMTK Reportedly Plans IPO. Compilation of news for today. January 14, 2025

tickerNews.title: AKRA: 2025 Guidance and Land Sale to ANTM
tickerNews.content: Management of AKR Corporindo ($AKRA) announced guidance for 2025 with the following details: Net profit around 2.4-2.6 trillion rupiah, higher by +4-18% YoY from the consensus 2024 net profit estimate in the range of 2.2-2.3 trillion rupiah. AKRA's net profit estimate for 2024 from its own consensus is lower by about 18-21% YoY from AKRA's net profit in 2023 at the level of 2.8 trillion rupiah. Net profit from the fuel trading and chemical distribution segment is targeted to grow +5-7% YoY, which is expected to be driven by fuel demand from the mining sector and new chemical sales. Land sales in JIIPE, Gresik are targeted to reach about 80-110 hectares (vs. 9M24 realization: 32 hectares), driven by sales postponed in 2024 and recognized in 2025, such as 50 hectares from Sichuan Hebang Biotechnology Co. and 30 hectares from other clients. Revenue from utilities is projected to increase significantly along with the start of operations for tenants in JIIPE, Xinyi Glass, and the normalization of PT Freeport Indonesia's smelter operations in mid-2025. Besides the 2025 guidance, AKRA also signed an agreement for land sale to Aneka Tambang ($ANTM) on December 27, 2024, although details regarding land area and transaction value were not mentioned. According to ANTM's Business Development Director, I Dewa Wirantaya, the presence of PT Freeport Indonesia's smelter in JIIPE will provide additional benefits for ANTM as the company has direct access to 99.99% pure gold raw materials. In a separate transaction, AKRA's controller, PT Arthakencana Rayatama, purchased 1.5 million AKRA shares at an average price of 1,065.4 rupiah per share on January 7 and 9, 2025. After this transaction valued at approximately 1.6 billion rupiah, PT Arthakencana Rayatama's ownership in AKRA increased from 63.611% to 63.619%. This is the first AKRA share purchase by PT Arthakencana Rayatama in 2025, since it last accumulated AKRA shares in September 2024. Key Takeaway: We assess that AKRA's performance outlook for 2025 is relatively better compared to 2024. This is based on the low-base effect of 2024 net profit, which was suppressed by: 1) weak performance of the trading and distribution segment due to coal company RKAB permit issues in 1H24 and heavy rainfall at customer mining locations in 3Q24; and 2) weak JIIPE land sales which only reached 32 hectares as of 9M24. We also assess the target of 80-110 hectares of JIIPE land sales in 2025 as achievable, considering AKRA has secured a land sale contract of 50 hectares from Sichuan Hebang Biotechnology Co. which can be recognized in 2025 and the land sale contract to ANTM. Some risks that could hinder AKRA's performance in 2025 are: 1) regulatory or weather factors disturbing the performance of the trading and distribution segment; and 2) slow progress in JIIPE land sales. As of Tuesday (1/14), AKRA shares traded at a Forward P/E Ratio valuation of around 10x, slightly above -1 Standard Deviation of the 5-year historical P/E.

tickerNews.title: Superbank owned by EMTK Reportedly Plans IPO
tickerNews.content: $EMTK: Bloomberg reported that the digital bank, PT Super Bank Indonesia (Superbank), is considering an IPO on the IDX this year. Bloomberg sources mentioned that Superbank is seeking several banks to work on this corporate action, targeting a potential fundraising of around 200-300 million US dollars and a valuation of 1.5-2 billion US dollars. Bloomberg sources also stated that the consideration for Superbank's IPO is still in the early stages and may not necessarily materialize, and the details of the value and size of the transaction are still subject to change. Superbank's current investors include Elang Mahkota Teknologi with a 31.27% ownership as of September 30, 2024, Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB), Singapore Telecommunications Ltd. or Singtel (SGX: Z74), and KakaoBank Corp (KRX: 323410). Head of Corporate Finance and Investor Relations of Superbank, Ekaputra Aditya, stated that they could not comment on rumors or speculation.

tickerNews.title: Unilever Indonesia (UNVR) Shareholders Approve Divestment of Ice Cream Business and Appoint 3 New Directors
tickerNews.content: $UNVR: Unilever Indonesia shareholders on Tuesday (1/14) approved the plan to divest the ice cream business worth 7 trillion rupiah and the replacement of 3 company directors. UNVR President Director, Benjie Yap, stated that the divestment of the ice cream business is expected to provide a direct benefit to shareholders in the form of cash dividends, which will be distributed when the transaction is complete. Furthermore, the transaction is also expected to strengthen the company's cash position. The company plans to strengthen the foundation of its core businesses, namely personal and home care, beauty and wellbeing, and nutrition.

tickerNews.title: Siloam International Hospitals (SILO) Announces Plan to Acquire Hospital Asset Portfolio from First REIT in Indonesia
tickerNews.content: $SILO: Siloam International Hospitals announced a plan to take over the portfolio of hospital assets belonging to First REIT in Indonesia. SILO is currently the existing tenant and operator of the hospital asset portfolio. Transaction value details have not been announced, but SILO stated that this transaction plan is in line with the company's business expansion plans and is expected to have a positive impact on the company.

tickerNews.title: Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat (MIKA) To Open 2 New Hospitals This Year, Breaks Ground for 2 More in 2026
tickerNews.content: $MIKA: Head of Investor Relations of Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat, Aditya Widjaja, said that they will open 2 new hospitals in West Java and East Java in 2025. Aditya added that MIKA will also conduct a groundbreaking for 2 hospitals in Jabodetabek and East Java to be opened in 2026. MIKA management has not announced revenue and net profit targets for 2025, but is optimistic about achieving double-digit growth targets throughout 2024.

tickerNews.title: Multipolar (MLPL) Controller Sells MLPT Shares, Ownership Decreases
tickerNews.content: $MLPL: Multipolar Technology's ($MLPT) controller, Multipolar, sold 37.5 million MLPT shares at an average price of 8,000 rupiah per share on January 9, 2025. The total transaction value reached 300 billion rupiah. After this transaction, MLPL's ownership in MLPT decreased from 86.95% to 84.95%.

tickerNews.title: CLEO Targets Double-Digit Sales Growth in 2025, Adds Three New Factories to Become Largest Bottled Water Company by Factory Network
tickerNews.content: $CLEO: Sariguna Primatirta President Director, Melisa Patricia, said that they target sales growth of double-digit in 2025. To maximize performance this year, CLEO will open 3 new factories in Pekanbaru, Pontianak, and Palu, bringing the total number of company factories to 35. This number makes CLEO the bottled water company with the largest factory network in Indonesia. The addition of factories will be accompanied by an expansion of the distribution network, where CLEO currently has more than 380 internal distributors and more than 7,000 distribution partners.

tickerNews.title: Meratus Jasa Prima (KARW) Controller Sells Shares to Expand Retail Investor Base
tickerNews.content: $KARW: Meratus Jasa Prima's controller, PT Saranakelola Investa, sold approximately 9.7 million KARW shares at an average price of 1,325 rupiah per share on January 8-9, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 12.9 billion rupiah and was intended to expand the ownership base of retail investors. After this transaction, PT Saranakelola Investasi's ownership in KARW decreased from 78.68% to 77.03%.

tickerNews.title: Gajah Tunggal (GJTL) Utilizes New Rp4.4 Trillion Credit Facility from BBCA and 5 Other Local Banks to Early Repay Senior Notes
tickerNews.content: $GJTL: Gajah Tunggal announced that it has utilized a new credit facility worth 4.4 trillion rupiah consisting of 2 tranches with tenors of 8 and 9 years respectively from Bank Central Asia ($BBCA) and 5 other local banks. Part of the loan is intended to early repay the senior secured notes worth 175 million US dollars that will mature in 2026. This transaction is intended to mitigate foreign exchange volatility, considering the new credit facility is entirely in Rupiah currency and has a lower interest rate.

tickerNews.title: Indonesian Minister Plans Minimum Age Limit for Social Media Users
tickerNews.content: Minister of Communication and Digital, Meutya Hafid, said on Monday (1/13) that the government plans to issue regulations to establish a minimum age limit for social media users, although she did not specify what that age limit would be. This step is aimed at protecting children in the digital space.

tickerNews.title: Bank of Japan Deputy Chief Suggests Rate Hike Possible in January or March 2025 Meeting
tickerNews.content: Bank of Japan Deputy Governor, Ryozo Himino, said on Tuesday (1/14) that they will discuss whether to raise the Japanese interest rate based on the outlook to be compiled at the meeting on January 23-24, 2025. Bloomberg mentioned that Ryozo's comment indicates that the Japanese central bank is not ruling out the possibility of an interest rate hike this month, with most observers expecting a Japanese interest rate hike in January or March 2025.

tickerNews.title: Vale Indonesia (INCO) Shareholders Approve Appointment of Retno Marsudi as Independent Commissioner
tickerNews.content: Vale Indonesia ($INCO) shareholders on Tuesday (1/14) approved the appointment of former foreign minister for the 2014-2024 period, Retno Marsudi, as the company's independent commissioner, replacing Raden Sukhyar.

tickerNews.title: Green Power Group (LABA) Signs MOU with PT ZTE Indonesia to Explore Photovoltaic Renewable Energy Cooperation in Oecusse, Timor Leste
tickerNews.content: $LABA: Green Power Group ($LABA) signed a memorandum of understanding with PT ZTE Indonesia to explore photovoltaic new and renewable energy cooperation in Oecusse, Timor Leste. This cooperation with PT ZTE Indonesia is a follow-up to the memorandum of understanding for electricity sale and purchase between LABA and governmental institutions in Oecusse in December 2024, which includes LABA's cooperation plan with local companies to develop a 5 MW solar power plant (PLTS) facility and a battery energy storage system.

tickerNews.title: Maharaksa Biru Energi (OASA) Controller Increases Ownership
tickerNews.content: Maharaksa Biru Energi ($OASA) shareholder, PT Majukarya Mandiri Indonesia, purchased approximately 99.6 million OASA shares at an average price of 137 rupiah per share on December 24, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 13.7 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Majukarya Mandiri Indonesia's ownership in OASA increased from 4.12% to 5.69%.

tickerNews.title: Panorama Sentrawisata (PANR) Receives Interim Dividend of ~IDR 400 Billion from Subsidiary, Repays ~IDR 324 Billion Debt to BBNI
tickerNews.content: Panorama Sentrawisata ($PANR) received an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 400 billion rupiah from its subsidiary, PT Panorama Ventura Indonesia. Part of these funds was used to repay bank debt of approximately 324 billion rupiah to Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI).

tickerNews.title: Sarimelati Kencana (PZZA) Shareholder Albizia ASEAN Opportunities Fund Sells Shares
tickerNews.content: Sarimelati Kencana ($PZZA) shareholder, Albizia ASEAN Opportunities Fund, sold approximately 23.2 million PZZA shares at an average price of 203 rupiah per share on January 7, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 4.7 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Albizia ASEAN Opportunities Fund's ownership in PZZA decreased from 5.56% to 4.8%.

tickerNews.title: Sinar Mas Multiartha (SMMA) Plans to Issue Bonds Worth IDR 800 Billion with Final Offering Period on Jan 13-14, 2025
tickerNews.content: Sinar Mas Multiartha ($SMMA) plans to issue bonds worth 800 billion rupiah, with the proceeds intended for bond payment and working capital. The bonds consist of Series A worth 100 billion rupiah (7% annual interest and 370-day tenor), Series B worth 500 billion rupiah (8.25% annual interest and 3-year tenor), and Series C worth 200 billion rupiah (9% annual interest and 5-year tenor). The bonds have received an irAA rating from PT Kredit Rating Indonesia. The public offering period took place on January 13-14, 2025.
